title: Arsenal ace Kieran Tierney 'ready' for Premier League debut against Sheff Utd
text:

Arsenal left-back Kieran Tierney looks set for his Premier League debut on Monday after boss Unai Emery said: "He is ready to play."

Tierney looks set to join the returning Alexandre Lacazette in the Gunners squad for Monday night's clash against Sheffield United at Bramhall Lane.

Lacazette is back in training following an ankle injury, while Tierney has had to be eased into the Arsenal team after sustaining a hip injury shortly after signing from celtic for £25million in the summer.

Tierney has made two appearances to date for the Gunners - impressing in Arsenal's 5-0 win over Nottingham Forest in the Carabao Cup last month before also playing the full 90 minutes in this month's 4-0 Europa League win over Standard Liege.

When asked about the 22-year-old ahead of the game, Arsenal boss Unai Emery wasn't giving much away, simply saying: "He is ready to play."

(Image: REUTERS)

But Arsenal fans are eager to see him in regular action in the Premier League now he has played in two cup competitions.

And former Arsenal striker John Hartson says he'll prove to be well worth the £25m outlay - as he thinks he's a better defender than Liverpool left-back Andy Robertson.

Tierney asked not to be selected for the Scotland squad for the upcoming Euro 2020 qualifiers against Russia and San Marino as he targeted full fitness for the Gunners.

But Hartson says he'll make a big impact once he's up to speed.

(Image: Getty Images)

“People talk about Andy Robertson. I would say at this moment in time he has better delivery but Kieran is a better defensive player,” the former Celtic and Wales forward told the Daily Record .

“Kieran gets low and defends well and he can also play as wing-back if needed.

“People talk about Andy Robertson. I would say at this moment in time he has better delivery but Kieran is a better defensive player,” the former Celtic and Wales forward told the Daily Record .

" Arsenal probably got him on the cheap if you look at the fact Manchester United paid £50million for Aaron Wan-Bissaka," he continued.
description: Gunners fans will be keen to see Tierney in regular action after two appearances in cup competitions since £25m move
